content.title: Hepatic Artery Aneurysm
content.description: Second most common visceral aneurysm, located in common hepatic (63%), right hepatic (28%), or left hepatic (5%) artery. Increasing incidence due to increased use of hepatobiliary interventions.

etiology.pseudoaneurysm: Trauma, pancreatitis, liver transplant, percutaneous procedures

content.rupture_risk: Pseudoaneurysms highest risk; true aneurysms ~20% rupture if untreated

treatment.endovascular: Preferred for most - coiling with or without stent
treatment.open: Reserved for complex anatomy, failed endovascular
treatment.anatomic_consideration: Extrahepatic can be ligated if collaterals present; intrahepatic requires exclusion with preservation of hepatic flow
